I tried to reproduce with I20050126-0800 on Windows XP and I could not reproduce.
I'll try on Linux tomorrow.
Would you have a version of that type that was causing the problem?

It was the same version that's in the HEAD stream now. This bug persisted during
the same session of Eclipse but dissappeared when I restarted.

This doesn't make sense. The parser is the same and the source code is the same.
So I don't get it. Are you typing when you got it.
I tried to reproduce with your steps and it never happened.

More detail on my steps:
1. Open the Open Type dialog
2. Start typing "JavaDetailFormattersManager"
3. When the list is filtered down to two options, stop typing.
4. Hit the down arrow to select JavaDetailFormattersManager and press Ok.
5. The dialog remained open and the type wasn't shown, so I then pressed the Ok
button a couple times more.

That didn't do anything either, so I closed the dialog and looked in the log and
found the exception.
I tried exactly your steps with no luck.

Oh. Sorry that was a typo in the description. Yes, I'm in 20050126-0800. Like I
said, I haven't seen the problem since I restarted my session. I filed the bug
hoping the stack trace would be sufficient.

Thanks for reporting it, but that kind of error should happen all the time. The
parser has not changed for a while and parsing the same source, it should end up
building the same tree.
I can understand that stack trace. The expression on the stack has to be an
array initializer when invoking the method
consumeArrayCreationExpressionWithInitializer. So I would either expect it to
fail all the time, or never. But not sometimes. This is why I asked you if you
could have a concurrent job running.
I just realized that I lied. At the office, I still had 20050125 (not 26) installed.
Could you reproduce on more recent build?
I haven't seen this exception since filing the bug.

Closing as WORKSFORME.
Please reopen if you get it again.
